Wagner Labor ArchiveElmer Holmes Bobst Library70 Washington Square South10th FloorNew York, NY 10012(212) 998-2630tamiment.wagner@nyu.eduThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2018-08-07T20:11:03Finding aid written in EnglishDescribing Archives: A Content Standard
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Collective Bargaining Agreements WAG.346
1 linear foot in 1 record carton.
1946-1993 Materials are in English. The Collective Bargaining Agreements (1946-1993) contains documentation from major labor unions within the United States. The materials available in this collection consist of by-laws, summaries of member benefits, and annual program reports from media, entertainment, hospitality, fashion, graphic arts, and local state labor councils within the United States. A significant portion of the collection consists of agreements made between the Newspaper Guild of New York, Local No. 3, of the American Newspaper Guild and other New York State publishers. The collection also features agreements established between the American Newspaper Guild and the International News Service, Department of The Hearst Corporation and the International News Photos. The collection also includes agreements established between the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations (AFL-CIO) and other affiliated unions. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
Scope and Contents
The Collective Bargaining Agreements contains documentation from major labor unions within the United States. These materials include by-laws, summaries of member benefits, and annual program reports from media, entertainment, hospitality, fashion, graphic arts, and local state labor councils within the United States. A significant portion of the collection consists of agreements made between the Newspaper Guild of New York, Local No. 3, of the American Newspaper Guild and other New York State publishers. The collection also features agreements established between the American Newspaper Guild and the International News Service, Department of The Hearst Corporation and the International News Photos. The collection also includes agreements established between the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations (AFL-CIO) and other affiliated unions.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. Original order is unknown.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection, which were created in 1946-1993, are expected to enter the public domain beginning in 2066.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
There is no documentation concerning the provenance of these materials. The accession number associated with this collection is 2017.064.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Collective Bargaining Agreements; WAG 346; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
At the time of accessioning, materials that were loose were placed in new acid-free folders and boxed. These materials were organized into individual folders based on the different names of the labor unions present within the collection.
